channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fears of the French Government Collapsing Send Its Borrowing Costs Soaring
item.description: France’s finance minister suggested that a cornerstone of the European economy might need help from the International Monetary Fund if a political and...

item.title: DOGE Put Critical Social Security Data at Risk, Whistle-Blower Says
item.description: DOGE team members uploaded a database with the personal information of hundreds of millions of Americans to a vulnerable cloud server, according to th...

item.title: Billionaire Mark Cuban says that ‘companies don’t understand’ how to implement AI right now—and that’s an opportunity for Gen Z coming out of school
item.description: Forget AI taking jobs, Gen Z’s biggest opportunity is teaching people how to use the technology, the former Shark Tank star says.

item.title: Archeologists discover a stone age atlantis beneath Danish bay, preserved like a time capsule after 8,500 years
item.description: It's part of a $15.5 million project to explore sunken Northern European landscapes as offshore wind farms and sea infrastructure expand.

item.title: The Coast Guard just dumped nearly 40 tons of drugs worth nearly half a billion dollars onto a dock in Florida
item.description: The Coast Guard worked with the Department of Defense to catch 19 drug-carrying vessels off various islands and coasts.

item.title: Israel Faces Growing Pressure Over Hostages and Gaza Offensive
item.description: As rallies spread to demand action to free captives, the country’s security cabinet was to meet for the first time since Hamas agreed to a new cease-f...

item.title: Trump media firm raises $6.4 billion to invest in Crypto.com’s digital token, deal includes purchase of Trump stock
item.description: The value of the Cronos token soared on news of the deal, which includes a $5 billion credit line and $200 million in cash.

item.title: The U.S. Open Already Has a Winner: the Honey Deuce Cocktail
item.description: The cherry-blossom-pink vodka concoction is entering its 18th year as the event’s signature drink. And it’s still a cash cow.

item.title: Quiz: Are You Prepared for a Climate Disaster?
item.description: Test your knowledge of how to handle hurricanes, wildfires and more.

item.title: Boomer NYU professor says Gen Z’s lazy label comes from zero faith in the payoff of hard work—and a fear that the world will end in 20 years anyway
item.description: Baby boomer NYU professor Suzy Welch said people should sympathize with the “vulnerability and sadness” of Gen Z’s current situation—crippling debt an...

item.title: What to Know About the Journalists Killed in Gaza
item.description: Five journalists were killed in what local officials said was an Israeli strike on Nasser Hospital in the southern Gazan city of Khan Younis.

item.title: Protesters in Israel Demand End of War in Gaza, Freedom of Hostages
item.description: Israelis took to the streets to urge the government to take action to free hostages held in Gaza, as the Israeli military pushed ahead with a widening...

item.title: Israel Faces Growing Pressure Over Hostages and Gaza Offensive
item.description: As rallies spread to demand action to free captives, the country’s security cabinet was to meet for the first time since Hamas agreed to a new cease-f...

item.title: Journalist Mariam Dagga Killed in Gaza
item.description: Her colleagues mourned as they held onto the visual journalist’s camera, which she used to document the lives of Gazans throughout the war.

item.title: China Finds Buyers for Surplus Solar: Africa’s Energy-Hungry Countries
item.description: Overproduction in China has led to slashed prices, and buyers on the continent are taking advantage to sharply increase investments in clean energy.
